column2: What is your name? "Olympie." "You shall have fifty francs, and you shall be called Nicolette."
column3: What is your name? "Olympie." "You shall have fifty francs, and you shall be called Nicolette."

column2: He had all sorts of prejudices and took all sorts of liberties.
column3: He had all sorts of prejudices and took all sorts of liberties.

column2: You are finely taken aback, and really, you are excessively ignorant.
column3: You are finely taken aback, and really, you are excessively ignorant.

column2: This manner of procedure was good-tempered.
column3: This manner of procedure was good tempered.

column2: He added: "I insist upon it that the mother shall treat them well. I shall go to see them from time to time." And this he did.
column3: He added: "I insist upon it that the mother shall treat them well. I shall go to see them from time to time." And this he did.

column2: He took an immense amount of snuff, and had a particularly graceful manner of plucking at his lace ruffle with the back of one hand.
column3: He took an immense amount of snuff, and had a particularly graceful manner of plucking at his lace ruffle with the back of one hand.

column2: He dined at five o'clock, and after that his door was open.
column3: He dined at five o'clock, and after that his door was open.

column2: They had come into the world ten years apart.
column3: They had come into the world ten years apart.

column2: No paradise becomes terrestrial in our day.
column3: No paradise becomes terrestrial in our day.

column2: The younger wedded the man of her dreams, but she died.
column3: The younger wedded the man of her dreams, but she died.

column2: Her modesty was carried to the other extreme of blackness. She cherished a frightful memory of her life; one day, a man had beheld her garter.
column3: Her modesty was carried to the other extreme of blackness. She cherished a frightful memory of her life; one day, a man had beheld her garter.

column2: Age had only served to accentuate this pitiless modesty.
column3: Age had only served to accentuate this pitiless modesty.

column2: In spite of this favored Lancer, the label: Prude, under which we have classed her, suited her to absolute perfection.
column3: In spite of this favored Lancer, the label: Prude, under which we have classed her, suited her to absolute perfection.

column2: Mademoiselle Vaubois, perfect in her style, was the ermine of stupidity without a single spot of intelligence.
column3: Mademoiselle Vaubois, perfect in her style, was the ermine of stupidity without a single spot of intelligence.

column2: This is the case with passive natures.
column3: This is the case with passive natures.

column2: There breathed from her whole person the stupor of a life that was finished, and which had never had a beginning.
column3: There breathed from her whole person the stupor of a life that was finished, and which had never had a beginning.
